intro: Medicago truncatula var. cosyrensis, commonly known as the Cosyrenian medick, is a variant of the annual medick plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a low-growing herb with trifoliate leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically reaches a height of about 10–30 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in disturbed areas, along roadsides, and in dry grasslands. This variety is notable for its adaptability to various soil types and its role in ecological restoration projects.
